intro: Dalechampia tripartita, commonly known as the three-parted dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, commonly known as the spurge family, and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
